sentences: Perunan kuori on ohut ja ruskea.
Banaanin kuori on keltainen ja helposti irtoava.
context: The Finnish word 'kuori' has a broad meaning relating to the outer layer or covering of something. It can refer to the skin of vegetables like potatoes, the peel of fruits like bananas, the shell of eggs, and even the bark of trees.  It also translates to rind, crust, and husk depending on the context. The word declines based on case, as shown in the dictionary definitions provided, with different forms for singular and plural nouns, and possessive suffixes indicating ownership.
